pr_title: feat: Add metrics for pull query request/response size in bytes

timeline.bodyText: This is the only place where we have access to the response sent over the wire. That's why I had to pass the pullQueryMetrics object in here
timeline.author: vpapavas

timeline.bodyText: Instead of passing the things we want to measure, like the startTime or the requestSize, I figured it's cleaner to pass the pullQueryMetrics. Also, the response cannot be measured from in here
timeline.author: vpapavas

replies.bodyText: I think the idea was that PullQueryExecutorMetrics was encapsulated here, but I agree that you can't do everything that way.  Similarly, we cut corners in measuring time by putting that in here to maintain encapsulation.  Andy felt strongly about this, so I made it that way, but I agree that if we want to measure size, it should be moved out.  I think we should measure time in exactly the same manner since we're already pulling PullQueryExecutorMetrics out.
replies.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: I am not measuring the request/response here since I don't have access to the HttpServerRequest/HttpServerResponse objects here
timeline.author: vpapavas
AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Unnecessary whitespace changes make it harder to use blame.
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText: The formatting is off here, when we break arguments in multiple lines, the first one must be in a new line as well
replies.author: vpapavas

timeline.bodyText: Why did you remove how this was being done by encapsulating the nowNanos?  It prevented you from having to do that all over.
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText: Added it back, you are right
replies.author: vpapavas

timeline.bodyText: Why not do recordLatency here too?  You can even record the start time here as well.  That way, they don't have to be sprinkled everywhere.  You would still have to handle the web socket since I don't believe it uses this path.
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText: Ideally we should measure every one of these endpoints in a generic fashion rather than having this special thing for pull queries, but maybe that is for a followup.
replies.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: This no longer measures the latency for this endpoint.  Why did you remove it?
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText: Yeah, you are right. I got a bit trigger happy with removing things. Will add it back
replies.author: vpapavas

timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: How is this time used if it's not injected in?  I suspect the test won't pass.
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: If you leave time injected in, it'll make it easier to test this class.  In fact, I would imagine it would be hard to test if it's using a wall clock.
timeline.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.bodyText: You want to record this when the response is complete in handleOldApiResponse, right?
